verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when all the kings which were on this side Jordan, in the hills, and in the valleys, and in all the coasts of the great sea over against Lebanon, the Hittite, and the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite, heard thereof;
verses.web: When all the kings who were beyond the Jordan, in the hill country, and in the lowland, and on all the shore of the great sea in front of Lebanon, the Hittite, the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite, heard of it
verses.ct: When all the kings west of the Jordan heard what had happened — those in the hill country, the lowlands, and all along the coast of the Mediterranean Sea up toward Lebanon — the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites —

verses.kjv: That they gathered themselves together, to fight with Joshua and with Israel, with one accord.
verses.web: they gathered themselves together to fight with Joshua and with Israel, with one accord.
verses.ct: they joined forces and united to fight against Joshua and Israel.

verses.kjv: And when the inhabitants of Gibeon heard what Joshua had done unto Jericho and to Ai,
verses.web: But when the inhabitants of Gibeon heard what Joshua had done to Jericho and to Ai,
verses.ct: But when the people of Gibeon heard what Joshua had done to Jericho and Ai,

verses.kjv: They did work wilily, and went and made as if they had been ambassadors, and took old sacks upon their asses, and wine bottles, old, and rent, and bound up;
verses.web: they also resorted to a ruse, and went and made as if they had been ambassadors, and took old sacks on their donkeys, and old, torn-up and bound up wine skins,
verses.ct: they came up with a scheme. They disguised themselves as ambassadors from a distant land, loading their donkeys with worn-out sacks and old wineskins that were cracked and patched back together.

verses.kjv: And old shoes and clouted upon their feet, and old garments upon them; and all the bread of their provision was dry and mouldy.
verses.web: and old and patched sandals on their feet, and wore old garments. All the bread of their food supply was dry and moldy.
verses.ct: They put on worn-out, patched sandals and ragged clothes. Even the bread they brought was dry and covered in mold.

verses.kjv: And they went to Joshua unto the camp at Gilgal, and said unto him, and to the men of Israel, We be come from a far country: now therefore make ye a league with us.
verses.web: They went to Joshua at the camp at Gilgal, and said to him and to the men of Israel, “We have come from a far country. Now therefore make a covenant with us.”
verses.ct: They traveled to Joshua's camp at Gilgal and said to him and the men of Israel, "We've come from a distant country. Please make a covenant with us."

verses.kjv: And the men of Israel said unto the Hivites, Peradventure ye dwell among us; and how shall we make a league with you?
verses.web: The men of Israel said to the Hivites, “What if you live among us? How could we make a covenant with you?”
verses.ct: The men of Israel said to the Hivites, "How do we know you don't actually live right here among us? If you do, we can't make a covenant with you."

verses.kjv: And they said unto Joshua, We are thy servants. And Joshua said unto them, Who are ye? and from whence come ye?
verses.web: They said to Joshua, “We are your servants.” Joshua said to them, “Who are you? Where do you come from?”
verses.ct: They told Joshua, "We are your servants." But Joshua pressed them: "Who are you? Where do you come from?"

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, From a very far country thy servants are come because of the name of the LORD thy God: for we have heard the fame of him, and all that he did in Egypt,
verses.web: They said to him, “Your servants have come from a very far country because of the name of LORD your God; for we have heard of his fame, all that he did in Egypt,
verses.ct: They answered, "Your servants have traveled from a very distant country because of the fame of the LORD your God. We've heard about everything he did in Egypt,

verses.kjv: And all that he did to the two kings of the Amorites, that were beyond Jordan, to Sihon king of Heshbon, and to Og king of Bashan, which was at Ashtaroth.
verses.web: and all that he did to the two kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan, to Sihon king of Heshbon and to Og king of Bashan, who was at Ashtaroth.
verses.ct: and everything he did to the 2 Amorite kings east of the Jordan — Sihon king of Heshbon and Og king of Bashan, who ruled from Ashtaroth.

verses.kjv: Wherefore our elders and all the inhabitants of our country spake to us, saying, Take victuals with you for the journey, and go to meet them, and say unto them, We are your servants: therefore now make ye a league with us.
verses.web: Our elders and all the inhabitants of our country spoke to us, saying, ‘Take supplies in your hand for the journey, and go to meet them. Tell them, “We are your servants. Now make a covenant with us.” ’
verses.ct: So our elders and everyone in our country told us, 'Pack food for the journey and go meet them. Tell them, "We are your servants — please make a covenant with us."'

verses.kjv: This our bread we took hot for our provision out of our houses on the day we came forth to go unto you; but now, behold, it is dry, and it is mouldy:
verses.web: This our bread we took hot for our supplies out of our houses on the day we went out to go to you; but now, behold, it is dry, and has become moldy.
verses.ct: Look at our bread — it was hot and fresh from the oven the day we left home to come to you. But now it's dry and covered in mold.

verses.kjv: And these bottles of wine, which we filled, were new; and, behold, they be rent: and these our garments and our shoes are become old by reason of the very long journey.
verses.web: These wine skins, which we filled, were new; and behold, they are torn. These our garments and our sandals have become old because of the very long journey.”
verses.ct: These wineskins were brand new when we filled them, and now look — they're split open. Our clothes and sandals are falling apart from the incredibly long journey."

verses.kjv: And the men took of their victuals, and asked not counsel at the mouth of the LORD.
verses.web: The men sampled their provisions, and didn’t ask counsel from LORD’s mouth.
verses.ct: The Israelite leaders examined their supplies but never asked the LORD for guidance.

verses.kjv: And Joshua made peace with them, and made a league with them, to let them live: and the princes of the congregation sware unto them.
verses.web: Joshua made peace with them, and made a covenant with them, to let them live. The princes of the congregation swore to them.
verses.ct: Joshua made a peace treaty with them and entered into a covenant to let them live. The leaders of the community confirmed it with an oath.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of three days after they had made a league with them, that they heard that they were their neighbours, and that they dwelt among them.
verses.web: At the end of three days after they had made a covenant with them, they heard that they were their neighbors, and that they lived among them.
verses.ct: 3 days after making the covenant, the Israelites discovered the truth: these people were actually their neighbors, living right in the area.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel journeyed, and came unto their cities on the third day. Now their cities were Gibeon, and Chephirah, and Beeroth, and Kirjathjearim.
verses.web: The children of Israel traveled and came to their cities on the third day. Now their cities were Gibeon, Chephirah, Beeroth, and Kiriath Jearim.
verses.ct: The Israelites set out and reached the Gibeonite cities on the 3rd day. Their cities were Gibeon, Chephirah, Beeroth, and Kirjathjearim.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel smote them not, because the princes of the congregation had sworn unto them by the LORD God of Israel. And all the congregation murmured against the princes.
verses.web: The children of Israel didn’t strike them, because the princes of the congregation had sworn to them by LORD, the God of Israel. All the congregation murmured against the princes.
verses.ct: But the Israelites didn't attack them, because the leaders had sworn an oath to them by the LORD, the God of Israel. The whole community grumbled against the leaders for this.

verses.kjv: But all the princes said unto all the congregation, We have sworn unto them by the LORD God of Israel: now therefore we may not touch them.
verses.web: But all the princes said to all the congregation, “We have sworn to them by LORD, the God of Israel. Now therefore we may not touch them.
verses.ct: But all the leaders told the people, "We swore an oath to them by the LORD, the God of Israel. We cannot touch them now.

verses.kjv: This we will do to them; we will even let them live, lest wrath be upon us, because of the oath which we sware unto them.
verses.web: We will do this to them, and let them live; lest wrath be on us, because of the oath which we swore to them.”
verses.ct: Here's what we'll do — we'll let them live. Otherwise God's anger will fall on us for breaking the oath we swore to them."

verses.kjv: And the princes said unto them, Let them live; but let them be hewers of wood and drawers of water unto all the congregation; as the princes had promised them.
verses.web: The princes said to them, “Let them live.” So they became wood cutters and drawers of water for all the congregation, as the princes had spoken to them.
verses.ct: The leaders continued, "Let them live, but they'll serve as woodcutters and water carriers for the whole community." This is what the leaders had decided.

verses.kjv: And Joshua called for them, and he spake unto them, saying, Wherefore have ye beguiled us, saying, We are very far from you; when ye dwell among us?
verses.web: Joshua called for them, and he spoke to them, saying, “Why have you deceived us, saying, ‘We are very far from you,’ when you live among us?
verses.ct: Joshua summoned the Gibeonites and confronted them: "Why did you deceive us? You told us, 'We live very far from you,' when you've been living right here among us the whole time.

verses.kjv: Now therefore ye are cursed, and there shall none of you be freed from being bondmen, and hewers of wood and drawers of water for the house of my God.
verses.web: Now therefore you are cursed, and some of you will never fail to be slaves, both wood cutters and drawers of water for the house of my God.”
verses.ct: Because of this, you are now cursed. From now on, your people will always serve as slaves — cutting wood and carrying water for the house of my God."

verses.kjv: And they answered Joshua, and said, Because it was certainly told thy servants, how that the LORD thy God commanded his servant Moses to give you all the land, and to destroy all the inhabitants of the land from before you, therefore we were sore afraid of our lives because of you, and have done this thing.
verses.web: They answered Joshua, and said, “Because your servants were certainly told how LORD your God commanded his servant Moses to give you all the land, and to destroy all the inhabitants of the land from before you. Therefore we were very afraid for our lives because of you, and have done this thing.
verses.ct: They answered Joshua, "We did this because we were told plainly that the LORD your God commanded his servant Moses to give you this entire land and to wipe out everyone living in it. We were terrified for our lives because of you, so we did what we did.

verses.kjv: And now, behold, we are in thine hand: as it seemeth good and right unto thee to do unto us, do.
verses.web: Now, behold, we are in your hand. Do to us as it seems good and right to you to do.”
verses.ct: Now we're in your hands. Do whatever you think is right and fair."

verses.kjv: And so did he unto them, and delivered them out of the hand of the children of Israel, that they slew them not.
verses.web: He did so to them, and delivered them out of the hand of the children of Israel, so that they didn’t kill them.
verses.ct: So Joshua spared them. He protected them from the Israelites, and they were not killed.

verses.kjv: And Joshua made them that day hewers of wood and drawers of water for the congregation, and for the altar of the LORD, even unto this day, in the place which he should choose.
verses.web: That day Joshua made them wood cutters and drawers of water for the congregation and for LORD’s altar to this day, in the place which he should choose.
verses.ct: That day Joshua assigned them to be woodcutters and water carriers for the community and for the altar of the LORD — a role they continue to fill to this day — in whatever place the LORD would choose.
